p:
The initial conditions are given by the proportion of the population that has HA-specific immunity, given prior epidemic sizes and the amount of antigenic drift that has occurred (see below), along with two types of vaccination programme, which are completed prior to each epidemic and with random coverage, irrespective of an individualâ€™s exposure history or immune status: conventional vaccination displaces individuals from S to R and from S
(cp) to R
(cp) , while universal vaccination displaces individuals from S to S
(cp) and R to R
(cp) .
